result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.
by DHS

10:12 AM Defendant Melvin F Bogus not in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Melvin F Bogus.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in Federal Custody in Terre Haute, IN; DCSO indicated that they are unable to writ defendant from that facility for further proceedings. Attorney Frank noted letter from defendant requesting competency evaluation but declined to independently raise issue at this hearing, provided proposed Order for Competency Evaluation on behalf of defendant. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Competency hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

02:11 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
